sentences.sentence: The Happy Prince( 王子 )
High above the city, on a tall column( 柱子 ), stood the statue( 雕像 ) of the Happy Prince( 王子 ).
He was covered all over with a thin layer( 层 ) of fine gold,
for eyes he had two bright sapphires( 蓝宝石 ),
and on his sword( 宝剑 ) there was a large ruby( 红宝石 ).
The people in the city all admired( 欣赏 ) him.
“He is as beautiful as a church bell,” said the Town Mayor( 市长 ), who wanted to impress( 给...留下深刻印象 ) people with his fine artistic taste.
“But he is not quite so useful,” he added,
because he was afraid that people might not think that he was practical, when in fact he was.
“Why can’t you be like the Happy Prince( 王子 )?” a mother asked her little boy when he was crying.
“The Happy Prince( 王子 ) never cries about anything.”
“I am glad there is someone in the world who is so happy,”
a sad man said to himself as he looked at the wonderful statue( 雕像 ).
“He looks just like an angel( 天使 ),” said the school children, as they walked back home from church.
“How do you know?” said their teacher.
“You have never seen an angel( 天使 ).”
“Yes, we have, but only in our dreams,” answered the children.
Their teacher frowned( 皱眉 ) and looked very serious, because he did not think that children should be allowed to dream.
One night, a little Swallow( 燕子 ) flew over the city.
At first, he didn’t pay much attention to( 多加注意 ) the Happy Prince( 王子 ).
The Swallow( 燕子 )’s friends had gone away to Egypt( 埃及，地名 ) six weeks before,
but he had stayed behind, because he was in love with a beautiful Reed( 芦苇 ).
He had met her early in the spring, while he was chasing after( 追逐 ) a big yellow butterfly( 蝴蝶 ) down the river.
He thought she was beautiful, especially because she had a thin waist( 腰部 ),
and so he stopped to talk to her.
“Will you let me love you?” said the Swallow( 燕子 ), who liked to come to the point( 直奔主题 ) at once.
The Reed( 芦苇 ) gave him a low bow( 点头 ),
and so he flew around and around her, touching the water gently with his wings.
This was the way he showed his love, and it lasted all through the summer.
“It is foolish( 愚蠢的 ) to love her,” the other Swallows( 燕子 ) all said.
“She has no money, and far too large a family.”
And indeed the river was quite full of Reeds( 芦苇 ).
Then, when the autumn came, the other Swallows( 燕子 ) all flew away.
After his friends had gone, the Swallow( 燕子 ) felt lonely,
and began to grow tired of the Reed( 芦苇 ).
“She has nothing to say,” he said,
“and I am afraid that she is a flirt( 水性杨花的人 ), for she is always dancing with the wind.”
And it was true, whenever the wind blew, the Reed( 芦苇 ) would bend( 弯曲 ) backward and forward.
“I know that she often stays at home,” he continued,
“but I love traveling, and so should my wife.”
“Will you come away with me?” he said finally to her,
but the Reed( 芦苇 ) shook her head, because she loved her home too much.
“You have only been playing games with me,” he said with a broken heart.
“I am leaving for Egypt( 埃及，地名 ). Goodbye!” and after saying this he flew away.

question.cn: 城市的市长为什么说快乐王子的雕像不是很有用？
question.en: Why did the Town Mayor say that the statue is not useful?

options.cn: 他怕人们认为他不务实。
options.en: He was afraid that people might think he was unpractical.

options.cn: 他想用自己的雕像替代快乐王子的雕像。
options.en: He wanted to replace it with the statue of himself.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘but he is not quite so useful,’he added, because he was afraid that people might not think he was practical. . . ”他怕市民们认为他不务实，因此选A。

question.cn: 六周之前，为什么燕子没有和朋友一起去埃及？
question.en: Why did the Swallow not go to Egypt with his friends six weeks ago?

options.cn: 他太老了以至于飞不了这么远的路程。
options.en: He was too old to fly such a long journey.

options.cn: 他爱上了一个漂亮的芦苇小姐。
options.en: He fell in love with a pretty Reed.

analysis: 文中提到：“But he had stayed behind, because he was in love with a beautiful Reed.”燕子留下的原因是他爱上了漂亮的芦苇小姐，因此选B。

question.cn: 燕子通过什么方式表示对芦苇小姐的爱？
question.en: In which way did the Swallow show his love to the Reed?

options.en: He kissed the Reed every day.

options.cn: 他满足芦苇想要的一切。
options.en: He gave anything the Reed wanted.

analysis: 文中提到：“and so he flew around and around her, touching the water gently with his wings, this was the way he showed his love.”燕子通过绕着芦苇飞了一圈又一圈的方式示爱，因此选C。

question.cn: 为什么燕子认为芦苇可能是个水性杨花之人？
question.en: Why did the Swallow think the Reed might be a flirt?

options.cn: 因为芦苇爱上了另一只燕子。
options.en: The Reed fell in love with another swallow.

options.cn: 因为芦苇总是与风共舞。
options.en: The Reed always danced with the wind.

analysis: 文中提到：“And I am afraid that she is a flirt, for she is always dancing with the wind.”芦苇经常伴随着风跳舞，因此选B。
